properties.name: University of The Sciences in Philadelphia

facts.fact: Every year this corridor hosts a $1 Baltimore Avenue Stroll. It showcases local businesses with $1 bargains.
The Baltimore Avenue Business Association serves 137 local businesses in the area.
Clark Park along this walk houses Dickens and Little Nell sculpture, which depicts the author and his character Nell Trent of the novel The Old Curiosity Shop.

Independence National Park houses 19 different historic sites.
Washington Square Park was established by William Penn as one of five green spaces in the city.
Washington Square Park, named in 1825 is home to 60 species of trees, including Philadelphia's only Moon Tree.

The sculptures on city hall were designed by Alexander Milne Calder, the father of the sculptor of the fountain on Logan Circle and the grandfather of the mobile in the lobby of the Philadelphia Museum of Art, called the Ghost, making this walk 'the father, son and (holy) ghost.'
There are 31 sculptures by 31 artists along the Ben Franklin Parkway.
French architect Paul Philippe Cret and the French landscape architect and planner, Jacques Gréber, modeled the Parkway after the Champs-Élysées in Paris.
